fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38473].
  {panel}

We use a triage system that has QA add the priority for issues submitted through issue collectors. Issues submitted through the issue collector do Not have a priority (since the collector doesn't ask for it). 

When going to Projects > (select project) > Issues > No priority is not clickable, like the other priorities are. 

Request: Can "No Priority" be made linkable to an issue filter that lists issues without a priority? 

I am aware JRA-30051 removed the link but I would like to request that it be readded if there are issues with no priority.
fields.summary: Provide hyperlink for "no priority" issues

fields.description:
The default PermGen in JIRA 5.x is -XX:MaxPermSize=256m and the default PermGen in JIRA 6.x is -XX:MaxPermSize=384m. 

Upgrade tasks should automatically handle the PermGen increase from 256m to 384m.
fields.summary: JIRA 5.x to 6.x upgrade does not increase PermGen / MaxPermSize from 256m to 384m
as a user i want to be able to use all jira gadgets as wallboards

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38469].
  {panel}

It is difficult to get Wallboards looking even good (let alone great).

One problem is the automatic sizing of the Slideshow presentation, which is not adjustable via browser zoom.

It is currently very tedious to experiment repeatedly with various combinations of layouts and widget placement to try to get everything actually visible on the screen, yet still big enough to be readable.

We are using a 16:9 screen (which most modern screens are).  Perhaps the wallboards were designed for and work better for the older standard ratio 4:3.

-Johnny
fields.summary: Add configuration for wallboard sizing
As a new user I want to figure out how cycling works easily
Better Wallboard display for users who are not logged in
Add option for label for each gadget
Filter Results do not scroll when exceeding visible screen height

fields.summary: as a user i want to add filter results to see what actual going on
Option to add dashboard name to displayed wallboard
Configurable background color for the Wallboard
Ability to remove wallboard option for Anonymous users
Missing documentation for JIRA Wallboard plugin

fields.description:
Add-ons that we disable are re-enabling themselves automatically.We have had the "Harvest TIme Tracking", "DonayIncentify" and "Quandora" add-ons enabled for a while but then disable them through the 'Manage Add-ons' page.

However, periodically (sometimes the next day, sometimes after a few days), the add-ons have re-enabled themselves. They are cluttering up our interface when creating/editing issues (as we no longer use them) as well as sucking up time having to disable them every time they pop back up.
fields.summary: Disabled Add-ons re-enabling automatically

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38458].
  {panel}

1. Create a dashboard
2. Kill the session externally (I did this by opening a second browser/tab and choosing Log Out")
3. Select Tools / Set Up Wallboard Slideshow

Expected result: A friendly error message indicating the need to authenticate
Actual result: huge NPE stack trace in the dialog box (see attachments)
fields.summary: NPE in Set Up Wallboard Slideshow if session is invalidated
Cycle period is  not working in Wallboard Slideshow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38456].
  {panel}

-In IE10 and Chrome v30 the activity stream is blank when viewed as a wallboard.-
The activity stream is being looked at in [JRA-36134|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-36134]

In addition the agile board widget is also blank but this occurs only in IE10 (Appears to be OK in IE 11).

Other odd rendering issues:
The burndown chart widget appears to be incorrectly formatted - something wrong with the axis font I think - maybe a style issue.

In IE10 the agile board widget is badly messed up in the normal Dashboard view - the content is spread out vertically over many pages - again looks like a style thing. See attached image.

We have tried to clear browser caches etc and tried different PCs - the same problem appears on all machines running IE10.
fields.summary: Wallboard and Dashboard rendering issues in IE10 & Chrome
JIRA Studio/OnDemand supports IE; bundled wallboard plugin does not

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38452].
  {panel}

We have two sources of git repos indexed by FeCru - a gitosis server and a Stash server. Gitosis is set anonymous read, Stash is (of course) secured. 

If I create a new dashboard, populate it only with the Activity Feed, only pick Fisheye. However, only the Gitosis commits show up with the project name - the repo activity coming from Stash is missing the repo name. To clarify, Gitosis repos show up like this:
Joe Smith <joe.smith@company.com> committed changeset 9e83e95803c70d48a9b6d7e1a94e263485297e72 to the Super Mega Awesome project
The same repo in Stash would show up like this:
Joe Smith <joe.smith@company.com> committed changeset 9e83e95803c70d48a9b6d7e1a94e263485297e72 to the project

Please take a look when you can...
fields.summary: Activity feed data missing on Stash repos

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38444].
  {panel}

Whenever view the wallboard, the following messages appear in the JIRA logs:

{code}
2012-09-10 18:17:14,795 http-8513-1 INFO anonymous 1097x2226x1 derixc 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /s/en_GBxzig5g/782/3/1.7.3/_/download/resources/images/InCycleDashboardSmall.jpg [atlassian.plugin.webresource.SingleDownloadableResourceBuilder] Unable to find resource for plugin: images and path: InCycleDashboardSmall.jpg
2012-09-10 18:17:14,795 http-8513-14 INFO anonymous 1097x2229x4 derixc 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /s/en_GBxzig5g/782/3/1.7.3/_/download/resources/images/InCycleWallboardSmall.jpg [atlassian.plugin.webresource.SingleDownloadableResourceBuilder] Unable to find resource for plugin: images and path: InCycleWallboardSmall.jpg
2012-09-10 18:17:14,795 http-8513-10 INFO anonymous 1097x2227x2 derixc 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /s/en_GBxzig5g/782/3/1.7.3/_/download/resources/images/FlatDashboardSmall.jpg [atlassian.plugin.webresource.SingleDownloadableResourceBuilder] Unable to find resource for plugin: images and path: FlatDashboardSmall.jpg
2012-09-10 18:17:14,796 http-8513-11 INFO anonymous 1097x2230x5 derixc 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /s/en_GBxzig5g/782/3/1.7.3/_/download/resources/images/spinner_blanket.gif [atlassian.plugin.webresource.SingleDownloadableResourceBuilder] Unable to find resource for plugin: images and path: spinner_blanket.gif
2012-09-10 18:17:14,796 http-8513-9 INFO anonymous 1097x2228x3 derixc 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /s/en_GBxzig5g/782/3/1.7.3/_/download/resources/images/FlatWallboardSmall.jpg [atlassian.plugin.webresource.SingleDownloadableResourceBuilder] Unable to find resource for plugin: images and path: FlatWallboardSmall.jpg
{code}

The problem can reproduce after install the JIRA Wallboard Plugin and access through "Tools" > "View as Wallboard"  .It seems that no functionality of wallboard was affected. In addition, the image that unable to be located seems to be sample images of wallboard in the JIRA Wallboard Plugin.

h5. In Chrome:
Subsequent action on viewing the wallboard(Exit and View it again) will not given the stacktrace but the following session id message:
{code}
18:55:24,820 http-8513-13 INFO admin 1135x2951x1 1nr9vcg 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /plugins/servlet/Wallboard/ [atlassian.jirawallboard.servlet.WallboardServlet] Session id is: 58457B12137B59089EBC2C018A99CBF3
{code}

h5. In IE8 and Firefox 15:
Subsequent action on viewing on the wallboard(Exit and View it again) will generate the stacktrace respectively on every access.

h5. Consequences:
Although no functionality of wallboard was affected, however the stacktrace was rather annoying and makes the logs slightly unreadable when generated non stop if a lot of user try to access it(especially IE and Mozilla behaviour).
fields.summary: Extraneous logging shown in logs after view the wallboard
{{ }} markup weirdness if there's an "s" after the last "}"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38436].
  {panel}

Hi,
We have a Agile board (configured for project ABC, & filter is configured using JQL query like below):
project = "ABC" ORDER BY Rank ASC

Now, say project ABC has been renamed to XYZ, then you can't see any issues under Agile board since board still uses filter JQL query which points to old project with name ABC.

Solution looking: So actually if project is renaming from ABC to XYZ then it should reflect at each and every place including JQL filer query. I think this is an issue with jira & needs to be rectify.

Jira System should able to update name at each & every place in system, as its not possible for user to go & check/change in each and every board that used old project name.

JIRA Agile (v6.3.13.1)
Reference: JSP-193610

Regards,
- Vishal
fields.summary: Chaging project name doesn't reflect in Advance filter query
Limit the number of issue attachment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38434].
  {panel}

*Problem* 

When attempting to configure a custom field display from JIRA Agile, if you select 'ALL' then select 'Custom' again an error will appear. 

*Steps to reproduce* 

1. Open a board in JIRA Agile
2. Select a specific issue
3. Type 'E' to edit
4. Select Configure Fields
5. Select *All* from the drop down menu, then select *Custom* from the drop down menu. 
6. Error is displayed **Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'getId' of undefined**
fields.summary: Attempting to Configure a Custom Field display from JIRA Agile causes error.
Add ability to set default tab for Project Overview

Accessing the https link from the "+Add Gadget" window doesn't have the expected effect in Firefox 29

Steps to reproduce:
1.Access the Dashboard using Firefox 29
2.Select "+Add Gadget" from the upper right
3.Click on the  https link on one of the gadgets

Notice that clicking on that link doesn't have the expected effect in Firefox 29

The gadget should be added.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38429].
  {panel}

Try to use the REST browser with the following URL
https://jira.atlassian.com/plugins/servlet/restbrowser

The result is a page opened with two sections, 
the left one with a spinning loader in it

With a little further investigation, the problem is probably with a .js file not found and reports as 404
https://jira.atlassian.com/plugins/servlet/$webResourceManager.getStaticResourcePrefix()/download/resources/com.atlassian.labs.rest-api-browser:assets/rab/rest-api-browser.min.js

The URL includes some statement that doesn't expand to a value ("$webResourceManager.getStaticResourcePrefix()")

It's the same result in IE, Firefox and Chrome
fields.summary: Unable to access REST browser on jira.atlassian.com

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38418].
  {panel}

Editing _User Property_ throws XSRF Security Token Missing, after trying to add a non-alphanumerical character as new _User Property_ key.

*Steps to reproduce*:
# Navigate to {{Administration > User Management > Users}}
# Search for a user and view the user profile
# Click the *Actions* button, and choose *Edit Properties*
# Add new *User Property* if there is none. Ex. key = *Color*, value = *Blue*
# Add another *User Property*, key = *>*, value = _anything_
It will fail as expected
# Click the *Edit* button to edit the existing *User Property*, and change it to any value

*Expected result:*
The value changed normally.

*Actual result:*
JIRA displayed XSRF Security Token Missing page. The value is changed afterwards.
fields.summary: XSRF Security Token Missing. The browser has provided ZERO parameters

fields.description:
Upgrading or migrating JIRA to a different location, {{jira.path.backup}} and {{jira.path.attachments}} are not updated in System Info upon restoring backup.

*Steps to reproduce*:
# Install JIRA 6.2.0 EAP into *Jira620Eap* folder
#* Create an XML backup of this instance
# Install JIRA 6.2.1 into Jira621 folder
#* Restore Jira620Eap backup into this instance
#* Check System Info - the mentioned paths still point to Jira620Eap:
!jirapath.png|thumbnail!
#* Create an XML backup of this instance
# Install JIRA 6.2.5 into Jira625 folder
#* Restore *Jira621* backup into this instance
#* Check System Info - the mentioned paths still point to *Jira620Eap*

It's witnessed that:
* the mentioned paths *always point to the original location*
* however, still in System Info, under File Paths, the paths show correctly:
!filepaths.png|thumbnail!

(i) Despite the incorrect path indications, JIRA functions properly and uses the correct physical paths

(!) This might have a side-effect on JIRA Title when creating application links, where the old title is referred to:
!applink.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: jira.path.backup and jira.path.attachments are not updated in System Info upon restoring backup

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38416].
  {panel}

We have both Jira and Confluence in house today. 

Our requirements elaboration process is more or less like this: 

Whiteboard > Balsamiq > Axure > Jira epic > Jira user stories > Development > "Move content to Confluence for both description of business rules as well as the user manual". 

Some time after release the improvements are registered. Minor adjustments to make it just a little bit more user friendly, changes to the business rules, etc. This is normally done in Jira. However, we see very often that we forget to update the business rules section in Confluence. 

So we would like to change the process a little - to get down the requirements in Confluence first before we start creating Jira issues. And when we start creating Jira issues, we only reference certain placeholders or similar on a specific Confluence page. This will ensure that the content in Jira is updated continuously as there is only one true source of descriptions. 

This "one source" idea is used by eDevTech with their product InteGREAT that manages requirements gathering and management together with TFS.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to include specific content from a Confluence page in a Jira issue so that I only have one source for requirements descriptions

fields.description:
Hi, I am running a jql query:
((PROJECT = CDS AND issuetype in (milestone, Deliverable) AND "Workstream/Team" in cascadeOption(10415) AND iteration != OoS AND labels = keydependency) AND (status = "Open" OR (status changed from "Open" to "Iteration Done" OR status changed from "Iteration Done" to "Complete" after "-14d"))), the query is red, it doesnt like it, however the results are what I am after. I get 33 results.

If I run it like the below, I get 21 results but query is green, it accepts it.
(PROJECT = CUDOS AND issuetype in (milestone, Deliverable) AND "Workstream/Team" in cascadeOption(10415) AND iteration != OoS AND labels = keydependency) AND (status = "Open" OR status changed from "Open" to "Iteration Done" after ("-14d") OR status changed from "Iteration Done" to "Complete" after ("-14d"))

for some reason it is returning tickets with open status and iteration done, however, it is ignoring the remaining query. I have tried minimising brackets etc, and know there are issues changed to complete within 14 days however they are not displayed. 

Is there a limit with how long the query is, or limit of brackets? Also, the query is displayed as red/failed however runs.  There are 33 items that meet this search, however, 21 items are only displayed. its like it stops reading the remaining query once it satisfies one condition, however,the code is OR, not and.

I changed the order of it too, like:
(PROJECT = CUDOS  AND ((status changed from "Open" to "Iteration Done" after ("-14d")) OR (status changed from "Iteration Done" to "Complete" after ("-14d"))) AND (issuetype in (Milestone, Deliverable) AND "Workstream/Team" in cascadeOption(10415) AND iteration != OoS AND labels = keydependency)) but I only got 2 results!

Can someone please advise? I have the same query running over multiple projects (for their project) and it is not behaving as expected.
fields.summary: Issue with jql query, not returning correct results as expected
Disable Conditions, Validators & Post Functions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38412].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Attempting to edit an issue for a disabled user is not possible as it displays the following errors:

* If they're the assignee: User cannot be assigned issues.
* If they're the reporter: The reporter specified is not a user.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a user.
# Create an issue and assign that user to it, and make them the reporter.
# Deactivate that user.
# Attempt to edit the issue.

h3. Expected Results

The issue is able to be saved.

h3. Actual Results

When saving the issue, the errors in the attached screenshot are presented and the issue cannot be saved.

h3. Workaround

This validation is not applied when using Inline Edit, so it's still possible to edit those fields in the issue. 
Alternatively the user could be renamed to lower-case, however, this doesn't seem to work in all cases.

h3. Notes

This happens for users in the JIRA Internal and Active Directory.
fields.summary: Unable to edit an issue when the user is deactivated

fields.description:

The log reports;
Caused by: javax.naming.CommunicationException: aptad.aptina.com:3268 [Root exception is java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused]

AD itself hasn't changed.
fields.summary: AD Synchronise fails

fields.description: If there is a workflowschemeentity that exists without a corresponding jiraworkflow, this will cause the View Workflows page to show no workflows. In addition, Quick Search can be broken. We could be quietly throwing an error in the logs and safely ignoring this condition, instead.
fields.summary: Orphaned workflowschemeentity prevents JIRA from listing workflows

fields.description:
when trying to make various changes users constantly get  XSRF Security Token Missing.  The link at the bottom for JIRA Administrators: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Disabling+Form+Token+Checking basically goes to a blank page.  So how do we disable XSRF security in JIRA V6.2.2?  

I already tried the only instructions I found which appeared to be for older JIRA versions but suggested putting jira-config.properties file in the JIRA Home Directory and that did not work.
fields.summary: XSRF Security Token Missing
Permissions based on Customfields do not work in all cases

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38406].
  {panel}

The SOAP service is able to do a part of it.
But it is depricated and it would be great to add the following functionality in the REST service. (With priority top down)

* User
** create
** update
** delete
* Group
** create
** update
** delete
* group membership
** add user
** remove user
** add nested group membership
** remove nested group membership
fields.summary: Extend REST API with Create/Delete User

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38405].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

Currently in JIRA comments posted by users can have invalid characters which can cause some problems later on when the data is retrieved for further analysis from Database or from issue exports. It will be great if it's possible to provide a validator that verfies the input text of a user and displays an error message durong posting such comment.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a workflow validator to check user's input in a comment.
fields.summary: Corrupted Characters Comment Validator
mandatory/required field while editing issue only

g table.

le.

{noformat}

*Reason :* The file {{[JIRA Install]/webapp/WEB-INF/classes/entitydefs/fieldtype-postgres.xml}} is not complete with all the field type definitions.

*Workaround :* Navigate to the file {{[JIRA Install]/webapp/WEB-INF/classes/entitydefs/fieldtype-postgres.xml}} and add these lines before the closing tag {{</fieldtypemodel>}}: 
{noformat}
    <!-- Special types for the QUARTZ tables -->
    <field-type-def type="quartz-char-8" sql-type="VARCHAR(8)" java-type="String"></field-type-def>
    <field-type-def type="quartz-char-16" sql-type="VARCHAR(16)" java-type="String"></field-type-def>
    <field-type-def type="quartz-char-40" sql-type="VARCHAR(40)" java-type="String"></field-type-def>
    <field-type-def type="quartz-char-80" sql-type="VARCHAR(80)" java-type="String"></field-type-def>
    <field-type-def type="quartz-char-95" sql-type="VARCHAR(95)" java-type="String"></field-type-def>
    <field-type-def type="quartz-char-120" sql-type="VARCHAR(120)" java-type="String"></field-type-def>
    <field-type-def type="quartz-char-200" sql-type="VARCHAR(200)" java-type="String"></field-type-def>
    <field-type-def type="quartz-char-250" sql-type="VARCHAR(250)" java-type="String"></field-type-def>
    <field-type-def type="quartz-char-512" sql-type="VARCHAR(512)" java-type="String"></field-type-def>
    <field-type-def type="quartz-boolean" sql-type="BOOL" java-type="Boolean"></field-type-def>
    <field-type-def type="quartz-data" sql-type="BYTEA" java-type="java.lang.Object"></field-type-def>
    <field-type-def type="quartz-long-int" sql-type="NUMERIC(18,0)" java-type="Long"></field-type-def>
    <field-type-def type="quartz-int" sql-type="NUMERIC(9,0)" java-type="Integer"></field-type-def>
    <field-type-def type="quartz-small-int" sql-type="NUMERIC(4,0)" java-type="Integer"></field-type-def>
    <field-type-def type="quartz-numeric" sql-type="NUMERIC(13,4)" java-type="Long"></field-type-def>{noformat}



PS: The issue might also occur for Oracle databases. If yes, then the same workaround would apply there as well.
fields.summary: Installation of JIRA is missing field type definitions for new tables in Postgres.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38401].
  {panel}

The new Issue Navigator/search behavior seems to have broken the workflow of our users and also a plug-in we use (E-mail this issue plug-in).

The little navigation on the right hand corner of the ticket (see attached screenshot) disappears the moment we exit the Issue Navigator.

How to reproduce:
1. Search for something
2. Click on the ticket ID above the ticket title. It should bring you out of Issue Navigator and directly to the ticket.
3. The little navigation on the top right hand corner that allows the user to move back and fourth between search results disappears

The e-mail this issue plug-in breaks because it sends the user back to the ticket instead of the Issue Navigator screen, and because of that our users have to keep re-searching so they can mail issues out (it's part of an approval process).

I would imagine this change in workflow would affect other plug-ins too, hence I'm filing this as a Fug.
fields.summary: New Issue Navigator/search breaks plug-ins
monospace & square brackets make comment preview lie

fields.description:
In JIRA 6.2 global transition loops (those with destination step = -1) got deprecated. They are expanded to ordinary transition loops for each status when the workflow is first opened in the new workflow designer - JRA-38337

However, it appears that common transitions can also be turned into loops by specifying target step=-1. The new WFD doesn't recognise that and fails trying to find a step with ID -1.

Need to expand such common transitions also. We'll convert them into ordinary transition loops for each status that uses the common loop transition.
fields.summary: Workflow Designer doesn't expand common transition loops

fields.description:
# Import workflow XML where some steps link to status ID-s that don't exist in this instance of JIRA
# Open that workflow in diagram mode
# BUG: workflow doesn't open, an "unexpected error" message is shown. The logs contain the stacktrace of a NullPointerException.

The problem is that currently WFD code assumes that all steps have linked statuses and that such statuses exist. It is not necessarily the case for workflows imported as XML.
fields.summary: Workflow Designer throws NPE if imported workflow links to missing statuses

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38397].
  {panel}

Hello,

Is there any way I can allow project leads the ability to add and manage users onto their project without having access to the rest of admin? Unfortunately admin console gives access to everything and I recently had to undo something someone a project someone had started to build in there that they didn't actually need. In most cases most project leads just need access to basic stuff like see who has access to their project and be able to create new users and manage them onto their project not other admin functions...

Thanks!

Louise
fields.summary: Separate create new user permission for existing project
Restbrowser doesn't seem to work

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When submitting an issue through the issue collector, clicking the 'not you' link does not disable the session check, so it's still possible to encounter the bug in JRA-38394.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Setup an issue collector.
# Set the session timeout to 1 minute as per [Changing the default session timeout|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Changing+the+default+session+timeout].
# Open up the issue collector.
# Wait for the user session to timeout.
# Click the 'not you' link and enter the user details.
# Attempt to submit the form.

h3. Expected Results

The form is submitted without error.

h3. Actual Results

The 'Oops! Something went wrong...' error appears.
fields.summary: The 'not you' link in Issue Collector does not disable the session check.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38394].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When users attempt to submit information through an issue collector, it can randomly display 'Oops! Something went wrong...'. There is no specific information about what that error is.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Setup an issue collector.
# Set the session timeout to 1 minute as per [Changing the default session timeout|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA062/Changing+the+default+session+timeout].
# Open up the issue collector.
# Wait for the user session to timeout.
# Attempt to submit the form.

h3. Expected Results

The collector displays a specific error about how the user's session has timed out.

h3. Actual Results

The 'Oops! Something went wrong...' error appears.

h3. Workaround

Increase the session timeout as per [Changing the default session timeout|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA062/Changing+the+default+session+timeout].

h3. Notes

There are at least two ways to trigger this problem. Let's imagine the session timeout is 10 minutes.
* Scenario A
** T=0m: The user opens the feedback collector
** T=0m: A new anonymous session is created (i.e. the user receives a JSESSIONID)
** T=11m: The user submits the form. The JSESSIONID has timed out and it triggers the 401 response.

* Scenario B
** T=0m: The user opens the feedback collector and receives an anonymous session (for example, JSESSIONID=123)
** T=1m: The user submits the feedback. Everything is ok at this point. The JSESSIONID=123 is still valid
** T=9m: The user opens the feedback collector again. As they still have a valid JSESSIONID, no new session is created
** T=11m: They submit the feedback using JSESSIONID=123. This session is now timed out, so they receive the 401.
fields.summary: Issue Collector displays 'Oops! Something went wrong...' if the user's session times out
JIRA to log when a plugin is successfully enabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38388].
  {panel}

h3.Background
JIRA always expects the user-tier for JIRA and plugins to be compatible. Which means that whenever a JIRA license having a different user tier is applied, it is highly likely that several plugins get disabled.

h3.Improvement Requests
h4.1. Provide warning on license update page
* Provide a warning on the license update page to make administrators aware that plugins which are licensed based on user tier could be disabled due to incompatible user tier.
{panel:borderColor=#ccc|bgColor=#FFFFCE}
(!) JIRA plugins may stop working if the new license has a different user-tier from the active. Please ensure that plugins which have licensing based on user-tier are also updated immediately to prevent them getting disabled due to incompatible user-tier.
{panel}

!License-Warning.png!

h4.2. Check new license and require confirmation on user-tier change
# Once the user submits the license, check the license if there is difference in user-tier between old and new licenses
# Warn the user again about user-tier changes and impact on plugins and ask for confirmation before proceeding to update the license.

h2.How to fix
The knowledge base article [Incompatible with Product License (wrong type)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=372605274] describes the workaround and how to get support.
fields.summary: Warn on license page about JIRA plugins getting disabled due to incompatible with product license type (wrong type) or user tier
Upgrade UPM to 2.16.2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38385].
  {panel}

Project avatar changes immediately after choosing new one in edit window. User do not have to hit "Update" in "Project edit window". This leads to situation, that  when we have different avatar in main project administration screen and differenc if we hit edit second time. If we reload project admin screen, we get new avatar.

Steps to reproduce the problem:

1. Go to project admin page
2. Hit edit
3. Choose new avatart
4. Hit cancel
5. See that main avatar is still the old one, however if user hits edit project second time will see new avatar. 

I believe that if we have Cancel button we should be able to undo the canges in the form.
fields.summary: Project avatar updates even when user hits cancel
Link to show all commit messages

fields.description:
The Cancel link has an invisible area around it where if you click you still trigger the "cancel" action, for me seems like it is treated like a button without borders and background.

This is confusing and can lead to unexpected behaviour because the indivisible area of the Cancel link touches the Create button and even a small slip of the mouse when you want to hit Create will close and cancel without any prior warning, causing the end user to loose all the data filled for the new issue.

As you can see in the attached screenshot, the mouse looks like is hoovering the "Create" button, but in fact the Cancel link (button) is highlighted and will be triggered on click.

I would recommend to make the Cancel act as a link and only clicking on it's text should work. This will create a small "eventless" space between them, or at least add a few pixels between the Create button and the Cancel one so it's harder to click cancel by mistake.
fields.summary: Create Issue dialog, "Cancel" link should behave like a link not like a button

fields.description:
You can put a newline in a JQL query, which can hugely improve readability for large queries by breaking it into multiple lines and indenting some lines. In JIRA 6, if you save the query as a filter and reload it, the newlines are gone, resulting in one long unreadable line.

I keep 20-30 large queries saved, and maintaining them is now more difficult. This is a regression from earlier versions.
fields.summary: Newlines in JQL are discarded from filters
Option to share created filters with other users

This inconsistency causing JIRA sending notification to administrator a day earlier than expected.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38371].
  {panel}

I am working with releases lately, so I decided to configure our CONFDEV project for the Fix Version to be mandatory - so I can take advantage of the JIRA Release Reports.

I want the _Fix Version_ field to be required in some of transitions to RESOLVED. But I want this field to be required only if the _Resolution_ field is equals to FIXED. 

Having mandatory fields when the value does not apply sometimes it's not good. If we resolve an issue with _Resolution = Won't Fix_, we don't really need the _Fix Version_ to be filled in. 

I might be wrong, as I am not an advance JIRA Admin, but I think JIRA does not allow us to do that for now.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Admin, I would like to configure a transition to force a field to be required only if another field has a specific value
"Product Release Dates & Features" page outdated with all broken links

fields.description:
h3.Problem
Linked issues is lost after validation of required fields.

h3.Replication Steps

1) Create a new issue by opening the "Create Issue" button in a new tab (http://xxxxx/secure/CreateIssue!default.jspa);

!1.png!

2) Fill the linked issues field with another issue but don't fill the summary one (required field) to force display the required field validation message;

!2.png!

3) Once you get the validation message saying the summary field needs to be specified, you can notice the linked issues is lost, although, the "due date" field and others still remains.

!3.png!

h3.Expected behaviour

It's expected the linked issues remain as all other values. 

h3.Work-around
Use all required fields on the same tab the linked issues is so you can have visibility if the link is lost.
fields.summary: Linked issues is lost after validation of required fields on the Create Issue page

fields.summary: Cancel button on Reports Page sends you to 404 error

fields.description:
h3. Summary

We set a limit for text fields through {{jira.text.field.character.limit}}. However, if we send an email to a project that has an incoming mail handler, and add enough text in the body to go past the limit, the bug is still created with a description that is over the limit.

If you then go to edit the issue's description field and don't change anything, the limit kicks in and it won't let you save it.

The mail handler should obey the limits on the text fields.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Setup a  of something to test with, say 10k.
# Restart the instance and verify the limit is in place.
# Send through an email with more than 10k in the body (baconipsum.com is good for this).

h3. Expected Results

The email is not created.

h3. Actual Results

The email is created, ignoring the {{jira.text.field.character.limit}}.

h3. Workaround

To work around it we've added a regexp validator on the workflow that we normally have problems with, but it would be nice if the global setting was, you know, global.
fields.summary: Text field size limit ignored by incoming mail handlers
Provide a way of rating JQL to advise a user how expensive certain queries would be

fields.description:
Hello,

We have noticed that when creating a ticket that if the “description” field has text that scrolls below the onscreen view, there is no scroll bar and the user must click into the field to edit it in order to see the full field info.
fields.summary: Scrolling Issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38352].
  {panel}

This has bitten me several times now while trying to work w/JIRA this morning.

While editing a Story, accidentally hitting "ESC" would _immediately_ cancel all of my edits and discard them.

Having been a vim user for 20+yrs, muscle memory leads me to hit ESC when I'm done an edit, but in JIRA that results in the immediate loss of all of the changes I've made, even when hit accidentally.

While I see [JRA-36670], where an Atlassian representative indicates that this is a "feature" and not a "bug", I believe he's incorrect.  Even after having disabled all Keyboard Shortcuts in JIRA, this accidental keypress causes immediate loss of work.

I'd be inclined to think that when Keyboard Shortcuts are disabled, that this keypress either no longer functions, or that it at least presents a warning/dialog to the user rather than immediately discarding all changes.

Further, I'd be hard pressed to believe that Atlassian's formal response would be "if you want to do any serious editing, *don't* do it our platform; use your own editor and then copy/paste it in".
fields.summary: Hitting ESC while editing issue immediately discards edits

fields.description:
h3. Current behaviour

When attaching a screenshot, action fails with a ClassNotFoundException.

This bug has already been supposedly already fixed according to [JRA-30747|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-30747] and [JRA-31838|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-31838], but it still happens on newer versions with JAVA 7.

h3. Expected Behaviour

The attach screenshot actually attaches the screenshot without displaying an error.
fields.summary: Attaching Screenshot fails with ClassNotFoundException

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
Note: Only been able to reproduce on my laptop screen, works fine on larger displays. 

Laptop details: Macbook pro 15" retina. Reproduced on 1920x1200, best (not sure what the resolution is when set to best) and 1680x1050.

1. Create a project with multiple versions (more than 20) i.e. 1, 11, 112, 113 etc

- go to create issue and in a version related field begin to type the first identifying character i.e. 1. It will display a dropdown on the right side of the screen without a scrollbar (see attachment).

- On edit seems to display other strange behavior such as displayed in the second screenshot (white background is displayed)

This has been reproduced on both chrome and firefox latest versions.

Workaround:

Open in a new tab.
fields.summary: Broken dropdown rendering when large number of options

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-38346].
  {panel}

h3. Current behaviour

When you search for a new plugin in the "Find new Add-Ons" section in JIRA Administration, you will have the option to "Buy" or "Free Trial" for the plugins. For an user who already has a license, it is not clear what is the correct option.

h3. Expected behaviour

Add a third option or modify one of the existing ones to clarify what has to be done for the user who already has the license (maybe a simple "Install" option).
fields.summary: Clarify the options to install plugins in JIRA

fields.description:
When viewing a printable version of an issue, formatting is lost when viewing in IE10.  Formatting is preserved in Firefox, and maybe other browsers.

Repro:
1) Go to an issue with formatting (e.g. in my case it was lists # and ##).  (Use IE 10)
2) Select Printable from the Export dropdown.

Expected:
The list formatting should preserved.

Actual:
The formatting is lost and all lines are aligned on the left margin, with no list numbering.
fields.summary: Formatting is lost when viewing printable version of an issue in IE10.
As an Admin, I would like Comment Handler comments to trigger Issue Commented instead of Issue Updated
Changes on Global Permission page

fields.description:
Unable to restore XML backup due to users referenced that JIRA can not automatically create

This is happening with any JIRA version, including 6.2.5 when you try to import a project from the XML backup.

Jira fails to import users that were removed from the original instance but that they had comments, or other activities.

User removal cannot be prevented in any way on JIRA when it is using an external directory like Crowd or LDAP/Active Directory.

Instead JIRA should just re-create these users using a fake email address for them.

This is an important bug that would prevent restoration from backup. Workarounds are not possible because here we are talking about tens if not hundred of missing users.
fields.summary: Unable to restore XML backup due to users referenced that JIRA can not automatically create

fields.description:
h3. Current behaviour

If you grant the "JIRA Users" global permission to an user, but he doesn't have "Browse project" permission in any project, he is still able to use the Issue Navigator and create Dashboards.

h3. Expected behaviour

Since the user won't be able to view any issue in JIRA, it doesn't make sense that the user has the possibility to "Search for issues" and create dashboards (since most part of the gadgets are issue-related) as well.
fields.summary: User without any "Browse project" permission shouldn't be able to run filters and create dashboards
